title: Saoirse Ronan and Emma Watson transform Little Women characters in film posters
text:
They're preparing for a 26 December release, with critics predicting Oscar buzz for the movie already.

And the stars of Greta Gerwig's adaption of Louisa May Alcott's novel Little Women have been transformed into the March sisters in the official film posters.

Saoirse Ronan, 25, Emma Watson, 29, Florence Pugh, 23, and Eliza Scanlen, 20, look sensational as the main characters with Meryl Streep, 70, also seen as Aunt March.

Characters: Actresses (L-R) Eliza Scanlen, 20, as Beth, Saoirse Ronan, 25, as Jo, Emma Watson, 29, as Meg, and Florence Pugh, 23, as Amy all look sensational as they transform into the March sisters in film Little Women's official posters

Emma, who plays Meg and was seen challenging the idea of needing to marry for money in the trailer, is seen wearing green and purple in a poster of the sisters.

In her stand alone poster the Harry Potter star sports her brunette locks down and wears a tailored blue jacket as she sits with an open book.

The second eldest sister Jo is played by Lady Bird actress Saoirse and she is seen in a bright red cape in the group poster shot.

Her individual image showcases the character's wilful and fiery personality by having the star running through a crowd with her skirt hitched up.

Upcoming: Emma Watson will play the eldest March sister in the movie and is seen smiling with an open book on her lap in a promotional poster for the film

Sisters: Saoirse Ronan plays Jo the second eldest March sister who is known for her fiery personality while Eliza Scanlen plays shy sister Beth and is seen playing the piano in her poster

Youngest: Florence Pugh has the role of Amy, who is the youngest sister and seen looking elegant while dancing in a blue ballgown in her individual poster

Third sister Beth is the most shy of the March girls and portrayed by Eliza, who last appeared in mini series Sharp Objects.

Her shyness is portrayed in the poster, showing her at home and playing the piano.

While youngest Amy, an artist who is chosen by her aunt and uncle to travel in Europe with them, is played by Florence and seen dancing in the promo image.

Florence appears with her hair pinned up and wearing a blue ballgown with yellow trim as she is span around by a male dance partner.

Period drama: Meryl Streep, 70, dons an all black ensemble including a lace veil as she transforms into Aunt March for the movie which is set in 1860s New England

Other characters are also revealed in the movie posters, including Meryl Streep as Aunt March who looks elegant in a period black dress and veil.

Timothée Chalamet, 23, who plays eligible young suitor Theodore 'Laurie' Laurence, is also sporting a white shirt and black waistcoat.

While the March sisters' mother Marmee, who is played by Laura Dern, 52, looks wonderful in a patterned green ensemble and clutching a bouquet of flowers.

After the first screening of Little Women on 24 October, the reaction was hugely positive, with many critics predicting Oscar buzz for the movie.

Roles: Timothée Chalamet plays eligible young suitor Theodore 'Laurie' Laurence and is seen stood outside in a white shirt in his poster while Laura Dern, 52, plays the March sisters' mother

Reactions included the likes of: '#LittleWomen: Gerwig makes this material her own in delightful ways you’d expect and some adult-meditation-on-childhood ways I didn’t. So rewarding to see the ease with which she paints on this canvas and that she (or any director these days) was given it.'

'Standing ovation for Greta Gerwig at this Little Women screening of SAG and press members #LittleWomen.'

'#LittleWomen could earn multiple Oscar noms, including best picture and directing for Greta Gerwig. As well as another for Gerwig for adapted screenplay. As for acing noms--lead actress for #SaoirseRonan, suppporting for #FlorencePugh and possible #TimotheeChalamet.'

First look: The official trailer for Greta Gerwig's adaptation of Louisa May Alcott novel, Little Women, was released in August and gave a glimpse of Emma Watson, pictured, as Meg

'Saoirse Ronan is going to land her fourth Academy Award nomination for #LittleWomen at the age of 25. In related news, I needed a two-hour nap today after stubbing my toe.

Set in 1860s New England, the film follows the journey of four fearless sisters - Meg (Emma), Amy (Florence), Jo (Saoirse) and Beth (Eliza) - as they each battle societal expectations.

Meryl Streep also transforms into the sisters' Aunt March, a wealthy widow who masks her naturally soft nature with a stern persona, while Laura portrays Marmee March, mother to the close-knit sisters.

The original novel, penned by novelist Louisa, was published in two volumes in 1868 and 1869 but has remained a popular tale.

Family: Set in 1860s New England, the film follows the journey of four sisters - Meg (Emma Watson - in pink), Amy (Florence Pugh), Jo (Saoirse Ronan) and Beth (Eliza Scanlen) - as they battle societal expectations

Cast: One of the March sisters captures the attention of an eligible young suitor Theodore 'Laurie' Laurence (Timothée Chalamet) in the movie. Also pictured is Laura Dern as Marmee

In 1994, Winona Ryder starred in another remake as Josephine March, a young women who dreams of becoming a successful author.

And in 2017, the BBC aired a miniseries version of the novel which featured Michael Gambon and Angela Lansbury.

Little Women will be directed by screenwriter Greta, 35, who earned much critical acclaim last year for her work on the coming of age film Lady Bird, which also earned Saiorse an Academy Award nomination for Best Actress.

Emma's role was originally intended for Emma Stone, according to Variety, who reported that she was unable to commit to the role, as she was working on The Favourite at the time.

'I love my sisters': In December of last year, Emma, who was last seen in 2017's The Circle, took to her Instagram to offer a first look at the project with a vintage snap of the cast
description: Saoirse Ronan, 25, Emma Watson, 29, Florence Pugh, 23, and Eliza Scanlen, 20, play the March sister's in Greta Gerwig's adaption of Little Women with Meryl Streep, 70, as Aunt March.
